column4: HOwever I know I'm allowed to explore the network and even the computers on the network as when I try in windows it works
Hey guys, I'm in a university setting and my samba share isn't working; when I click "Windows Network" nothing shows up at all
are the shares configured to be seen?
Yeah. I can see them in windows. ther'es about 50+ machines that come up.
also it really helps in everyone is in the same workgroup too
do you see the machines themselves when you do the places - network ?
No I do not, sir
hmm ok so that sounds like security/share settings on the winboxes maybe
or similar settings on the linux boxes
Hm. Are you suggesting that I'm not able to see windows shares through linux due to security issues/features in the network?
!ot > NightWolf
well two things comes to mind 1) firewall (probably not)  or 2) The actual shares on the other boxes arent configured to be shared or have network names for sharing
are they winboxes? or linux?
Probably Winboxes. I'm at a university, so it's a bit inconvenient to go around asking everyone
yeah - on those windows boxes admin has to right click the shares (folders) and set the sharing parameters
otherwise they wont show up
Yes, this I do know. So you're saying they won't show up in linux if they don't have shared folders?
But they will if you're in windows
correct they wont and yes they "might" on a win network - another possibility is that samba has been disabled on the winboxes (unlikely tho)
I see. There's also a chance I'm on the wrong workgroup entirely... i kind of stupidly assumed they were all in "Workgroup" since that's what it was at my house
yes that could be a prob also
